person.persName: John J. Curtis (Mason County, Kentucky, soldier - 1st. Lt. 11th Ky. Cav.)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Curtis and Mary Curtis. Attended school in Mason County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eleven enslaved persons in Mason County in 1850. Attended school in Bracken County in 1860. Household owned two enslaved persons in Mason County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a third sergeant, second lieutenant, and first lieutenant from September 22, 1862 to July 12, 1865.
